head.title: Letter from Ambassador Extraordinary to Russia Charles Whitworth to Under-Secretary of State George Tilson regarding the language of adressing to Tsar Peter I and his officials and difficulty and expense of providing mourning attire

note.p: TNA Kew. Russia, no. SP 91-6-1, f. 19-19v.

div.p: Now I am the most indebted for your oblidging Correspondence. I find myself in the least condition to pay, having been so taken up with writing to this Court in disposition, visits & other accidents, that I have only time to acknowledge the bare deth dates, the last whereof are the 12th & 16th Nov. by my letters to Mr. Secretary wherein you will decipher some lines you will find how the dispute sounds about the Ambassr. The language I write into this Court is pure High Dutch, the fashionable speech here understood by the Czar, Prince Menschikoff & extreamly well spoken by [note in the lower edge:] Mr. Tilson
